article.headline: Portland 84, Portland State 72
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Five Portland Pilots scored in double figures, led by Pooh Jeter with 19, as UP defeated Portland State 84-72 Saturday night at the Stott Center. Donald Wilson added 15 for Portland (5-2), while Jeremiah Dominguez and Ben Sullivan each added 12 points. Marcus Lewis chipped in 11 points. Seamus Boxley led Portland State (3-3) with 20 points and eight rebounds. Blake Walker had 13 points for the Vikings. Portland trailed most of the first half despite shooting 69 percent, but went on a 9-0 run and took the lead 28-27 when Dominguez connected on a driving layin with 6:51 to play. Dominguez rallied the Pilots the rest of the way and capped the half with a 3-point bank shot at the buzzer to give the Pilots a 46-41 lead at the break. The Pilots kept their torrid offense in the second half and hit three 3-pointers in the first six minutes to extend their lead to 63-53 with 13:30 left to play. Both teams offense dried up at that point. Portland State made only four field goals in the last 13 minutes of the game and never threatened down the stretch. The Vikings shot 56 percent from the field. Portland shot 57 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
